top_categories.workout_context: BWR Montana (Belgian Waffle Ride Montana)'s Montana Rockies gravel (75%), Paved roads (25%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 87 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic BWR Montana (Belgian Waffle Ride Montana)'s demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
106ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
9,186ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At BWR Montana (Belgian Waffle Ride Montana), surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of BWR Montana (Belgian Waffle Ride Montana). Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At BWR Montana (Belgian Waffle Ride Montana), that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At mile 60 of 87, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
9,186ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Montana Rockies—mountain technical terrain. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 9,186ft of climbing on Montana Rockies—mountain technical terrain does to your power file on race day.
Low-cadence force work for 9,186ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for BWR Montana (Belgian Waffle Ride Montana)’s 87 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at BWR Montana (Belgian Waffle Ride Montana). Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at BWR Montana (Belgian Waffle Ride Montana) demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride montana rockies—mountain technical terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: montana rockies gravel (75%), paved roads (25%), mountain terrain. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 87 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 87 miles of montana rockies—mountain technical terrain in Missoula, Montana.
